N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2186.5 - Evaluation of applications

State Regulations
(a) Selection factors. Completed applications satisfying the minimum program
requirements set forth in section
2186.4
of this Part will then be
evaluated further in accordance with the agency's criteria which shall be based
on the following factors: (1)
the
qualifications and prior experience of the applicant and the other program
participants in developing affordable housing projects; (2)
readiness to proceed with the
infrastructure improvements within a reasonable time frame as determined by the
agency, giving consideration to the probability of, and the anticipated time
needed for, securing approval from the applicable Federal, State or local
entity of the affordable housing project to be constructed or
rehabilitated; (3)
extent to which
the housing project will be affordable to individuals and families whose
housing needs are not being met by the private sector; (4)
the extent to which the affordable
housing project meets the need for an addition to the inventory of standard
housing units in the community; (5)
the absence of any litigation or similar impediment to the implementation of
the proposal; and
(6)
such other
factors as the agency may deem appropriate on review of the
application. Notes
